gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:name: clastic solid rock (apart from carbonate rock)

gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:description: generic term for soft or loosly grained earth and debris
gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:name: loose rock
pelitic solid rock (apart from carbonate rock)
psammitic solid rock (apart from carbonate rock)
metamorphic carbonate and calcsilicate rocks calc-silicate rock

bmlcl:BMLML_CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metamorphit, mittel- bis hochgradig, sauer bis intermediär
bmlcl:BMLML_CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metamorphit, mittel- bis hochgradig, sauer bis intermediär

bmlcl:BMLML_CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metamorphit, mittel- bis hochgradig, basisch bis ultrabasisch
bmlcl:BMLML_CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metamorphit, mittel- bis hochgradig, basisch bis ultrabasisch

gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:name: metamorphite, medium to high-grade, alkaline to ultra-alkaline

gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:description: generic term of metamorphic rock, grainsize of sand
gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:name: metapsammite

gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:description: generic term of metamorphic rock, grainsize of gravel
gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:name: meta-psephite

gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:description: metamorphic rock, grainsize of sand, with high quartz content commonly called quartzite
gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:name: metasandstone

gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:description: metamorphic variety of sandstone generally characterized by its hardness, dark color, and poorly sorted angular grains of quartz, feldspar, and small rock fragments
gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:name: metagreywacke

gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:description: highly altered granitic rock or pegmatite
gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:name: greisen

gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:description: metamorphic rock that is usually variably colored green or red, occasionally grey, black, brown or white, forms by chemical metasomatism of rocks during metamorphism in the contact zone of magmatic intrusions
gmx:CodeAlternativeExpression.gml:name: skarn
